channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: World Sickle Cell Day
item.description:
Monday, June 17, 2024

The  Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to support World Sickle Cell Day.

World Sickle Cell Day, which takes place on June 19 each year, is an internationally recognised awareness day promoting equitable access to treatment of those living with sickle cell anaemia and to break down stigma in the community.

This Light Up is organised by: Thalassaemia and Sickle Cell Australia

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:

This Light Up is organised by: Thalassaemia and Sickle Cell Australia
item.x-trumba:customfield: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: MND Awareness Week and Cornflower Blue Day
item.description:
Tuesday, June 18, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Mid Blue to support MND Awareness Week and Cornflower Blue Day.

The MND Awareness Week and Cornflower Blue day is about increasing awareness about this devastating disease. We're lighting up landmarks around Queensland in blue to represent our symbol, the cornflower - the international symbol of hope for Motor Neurone Disease. It was chosen because it represents courage... it can withstand drought and frost, and its rich blue colour never fades, no matter what pressure it’s under.

This Light Up is organised by: MND Queensland

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: 2024 Queensland Health Awards for Excellence
item.description:
Wednesday, June 19, 2024

City Hall will be lit Blue and Yellow to celebrate the 2024 Queensland Health Awards for Excellence.

This event is being held in City Hall.

This Light Up is organised by: Department of Health Qld

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:
City Hall will be lit Blue and Yellow to celebrate the 2024 Queensland Health Awards for Excellence.

This event is being held in City Hall.

This Light Up is organised by: Department of Health Qld
item.x-trumba:customfield: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Bowel Cancer Awareness Month - Red Apple Day
item.description:
Wednesday, June 19, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Red and Green to support Bowel Cancer Awareness Month - Red Apple Day.

June is Bowel Cancer Awareness Month, with the 19th Red Apple Day - Bowel Cancer Australia's signature event to raise awareness of Australia's second deadliest cancer. The funds raised are used for the leading community-funded charity dedicated to prevention, early diagnosis, research, quality treatment and care, so everyone affected by bowel cancer can live their best life. Bowel cancer claims the lives of 103 Australians every week (5,350 people a year) - but it's one of the most treatable types of cancer when detected early.

While the risk of bowel cancer increases significantly with age, the disease doesn't discriminate, affecting people of all ages.

This Light Up is organised by: Bowel Cancer Australia

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Routine Testing
item.description:
Thursday, June 20, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit to support Routine Testing.

The Story Bridge decorative lighting will undergo routine testing on Wednesday 1 November 2023, between 6pm and 9pm.

During this time, the Bridge will change through multiple colours and patterns before returning to the City of Brisbane colours of blue and gold once complete.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
item.xCal:description:
The Story Bridge will be lit to support Routine Testing.

During this time, the Bridge will change through multiple colours and patterns before returning to the City of Brisbane colours of blue and gold once complete.
This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council
item.x-trumba:customfield: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: #ShowYourStripes Day.
item.description:
Friday, June 21, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit DK Blue, Lt Blue to White, Pink and Maroon to support #ShowYourStripes Day.

#ShowYourStripes Day is a global event drawing attention to the changing climate, using the Climate Stripes graphics developed in 2017 and seen around the world: showyourstripes.info….

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Conservation Council

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
item.xCal:description:
The Story Bridge will be lit DK Blue, Lt Blue to White, Pink and Maroon to support #ShowYourStripes Day.
#ShowYourStripes Day is a global event drawing attention to the changing climate, using the Climate Stripes graphics developed in 2017 and seen around the world: https://showyourstripes.info/showcase.
This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Conservation Council
item.x-trumba:customfield: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Migraine Awareness Month
item.description:
Saturday, June 22, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures  will be lit Purple to support Migraine Awareness Month.

Shades for Migraine on Friday 21 June is part of our annual Migraine Awareness Month to raise awareness of migraine and raise funds to help Migraine Australia advocate and support patients with migraine. Migraine Australia is the national patient organisation for all Australians living with migraine. We provide information, advocacy and support to assist people to manage living with migraine and gain access to evolving medications and treatments.

This Light Up is organised by: Migraine Australia

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:
The Reddacliff Place sculptures  will be lit Purple to support Migraine Awareness Month.

We provide information, advocacy and support to assist people to manage living with migraine and gain access to evolving medications and treatments.
This Light Up is organised by: Migraine Australia
item.x-trumba:customfield: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Olympic Day
item.description:
Sunday, June 23, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit all colours to recognise Olympic Day.

Olympic Day is celebrated all around the world on 23 June, in global celebration of the founding of the International Olympic Committee and the modern Olympic Movement in 1894.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit all colours to recognise Olympic Day.

item.title: State of Origin - Game II Melbourne
item.description:
Wednesday, June 26, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Maroon to celebrate State of Origin - Game II Melbourne.

With the Mighty Maroons winning Game I in the 2024 Ampol State of Origin Series in Sydney, will they take out their 3rd consecutive series in Melbourne tonight or will we go to a decider at Suncorp. Gear up in your Maroon and get ready to cheer your team.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

With the Mighty Maroons winning Game I in the 2024 Ampol State of Origin Series in Sydney, will they take out their 3rd consecutive series in Melbourne tonight or will we go to a decider at Suncorp. Gear up in your Maroon and get ready to cheer your team.
This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

item.title: State of Origin - Game II Melbourne

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City

item.title: PTSD Awareness Day
item.description:
Thursday, June 27, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to support PTSD Awareness Day.

Phoenix Australia are experts in trauma-related mental health and wellbeing. For 25 years, we have been Australia’s National Centre of Excellence in Posttraumatic Mental Health and internationally recognised leaders in our field. We are committed to driving forward the mental health agenda both at home and abroad. This June 27 marks PTSD Awareness Day in Australia, a day dedicated to raising awareness and understanding of Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD).

This Light Up is organised by: Phoenix Australia

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: 2024 Myasthenia Gravis Awareness Month
item.description:
Friday, June 28, 2024

The Tropical Dome will be lit Teal to support 2024 Myasthenia Gravis Awareness Month.

Take a moment to reflect on your myasthenia journey. Capture the image and share so myasthenia can gain more awareness in the community. This will help research. This will help you with your myasthenia journey.
"Queensland Lights Up for Myasthenia" celebrates International Myasthenia Gravis Awareness Month

This Light Up is organised by: Myasthenia Gravis Association of Queensland Inc (MGAQ)

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong
